conclusion: Introduction to the problem and description of the graph with voltage and current.
Line 'a' is curved, representing terminal voltage of a battery or silicon photocell; line 'b' is straight, representing a resistor.
Explanation of the intersection point as the operating point in a closed loop.
Intersection point is at 2.5 volts and 0.2 amperes.
Calculate resistance R using Ohm's law: R = 12.5 Î©.
Discussion on finding internal resistance of silicon photocell.
Explanation of differential resistance and slope of U-I curve.
Curve 'a' starts at (0 V, 0.4 A) and ends at (3.6 V, 0 A).
Open-circuit voltage is 3.6 V, short-circuit current is 0.4 A.
Consideration of small-signal resistance at operating point.
Small-signal resistance is the reciprocal of the slope of the tangent at the operating point.
Discussion on equivalent circuits for the photocell.
Consideration of the photocell as a voltage source with internal resistance.
